context:
The text provides information about the application process for the Honours Bachelor of Brand Design program at the college. Applicants who receive communication from the college stating that they are being considered for the next stage of the admission process are required to submit an Application Questionnaire, resume (optional), and portfolio. The Application Questionnaire is designed to describe the applicant's future career objectives and intentions in the Brand Design program. The portfolio should include a maximum of 15 diverse pieces of the applicant's best creative work and may include sketches, paintings, photographs, videos, design, packaging, branding, exhibitions, digital art, physical or digital models, and writing samples relevant to this program. Confidential results will be submitted by the School of Design to the Admissions Office upon review of the Application Questionnaire and Portfolio. Applicants will receive notification via email and mail if they are successful in their application. The review and submission of results to the Admissions Office may take at least a week. Applicants should check stuview.georgebrown.ca for an update on their application status. If offered admission, applicants should accept it on ontariocolleges.ca as soon as possible to reserve their seat in the program. The text also includes a request to learn more about the land acknowledgment and to be kept informed of application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more by signing up.

No specific factual information is mentioned in the text related to the program offered by the college, such as the number of years or the names of the committees involved in the application review process.
